Indeed, he would recite in the dawn prayer of Friday the Chapter of the Prostration [as-Sajdah], Luqman, and the Chapter "Has there come upon man..." [al-Insan]. And know that among his [Satan's] stratagems [makayid] is to preoccupy you in your prayer with remembrance of the Hereafter [al-Akhirah] and planning good deeds, to prevent you from understanding what you recite. So know that everything which distracts you from understanding the meanings of your recitation is a whispering [waswas]. For the movement of the tongue is not the intended goal; rather, the intended goal is its meanings. As for recitation, people concerning it are of three kinds: a man whose tongue moves while his heart [qalb] is heedless; and a man whose tongue moves and his heart follows the tongue, so he understands and hears from it as if he were hearing it from anotherâ€”and these are the degrees of the Companions of the Right Hand; and a man whose heart [qalb] precedes to the meanings first, then the tongue serves the heart by translating it. So distinguish between the tongue being an interpreter for the heart [qalb] or being a teacher for the heart [qalb]. And those brought near [al-muqarrabun], their tongue is an interpreter that follows the heart [qalb], and the heart [qalb] does not follow it. And likewise, you must understand what you recite from the chapters, as will come in the Book of the Recitation of the Quran. So do not be heedless of its command and its prohibition, its promise and its threat, its admonitions, the stories of its prophets, the mention of His favors and His benevolence. And for each one there is a right: hope [ar-raja'] is the right of the promise, and fear [al-khawf] is the right of the threat.

a.g: And when our verses are recited to him, he turns away arrogantly as if he had not heard them, as if there was in his ears deafness. So give him tidings of a painful punishment.
Indeed, those who believe and do righteous deeds - for them are the Gardens of Pleasure.
Wherein they abide eternally; [it is] the promise of Allah [which is] truth. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

He created the heavens without pillars that you see and has cast into the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with you, and dispersed therein from every creature. And We sent down rain from the sky and made grow therein [plants] of every noble kind.
This is the creation of Allah. So show Me what those other than Him have created. Rather, the wrongdoers are in clear error.

And We had certainly given Luqman wisdom [and said], "Be grateful to Allah." And whoever is grateful is grateful for [the benefit of] himself. And whoever denies [His favor] - then indeed, Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy.
And [mention, O Muhammad], when Luqman said to his son while he was instructing him, "O my son, do not associate [anything] with Allah. Indeed, association [with him] is great injustice."

And We have enjoined upon man [care] for his parents. His mother carried him, [increasing her] in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning is in two years. Be grateful to Me and to your parents; to Me is the [final] destination.

But if they endeavor to make you associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge, do not obey them but accompany them in [this] world with appropriate kindness and follow the way of those who turn back to Me [in repentance]. Then to Me will be your return, and I will inform you about what you used to do.

a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol 2: Etiquette of Sama and Wajd
Indeed, the saying of Allah the Most High, "Indeed, the most disagreeable of sounds is the voice of the donkeys [aswat al-hamir]," indicates by its implication the praise of the beautiful voice [as-sawt al-hasan]. Likewise, the sounds perceived by hearing [as-sam'] are divided into the delightful, like the voice of nightingales and flutes, and the repulsive, like the braying of donkeys and others. As for the text, it indicates the permissibility of listening to the beautiful voice [as-sawt al-hasan], a favor from Allah the Most High upon His servants when He said, "He increases in creation what He wills," and it was said this is the beautiful voice [as-sawt al-hasan]. And in the hadith: "Allah did not send a prophet except that he had a beautiful voice [hasan as-sawt]." And He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Allah is more attentive to the man with a beautiful voice [al-hasan as-sawt] in reciting the Qur'an than a man is to his female singer and her singing." And in the hadith, in the context of praising David, peace be upon him, that he had a beautiful voice [hasan as-sawt] in lamenting himself and in reciting the Psalms. And He, peace and blessings be upon him, said in praise of Abu Musa al-Ash'ari: "He has indeed been given a flute from the flutes of the family of David." And if it were permissible to say that this was only permitted on the condition that it be in the Qur'an, it would necessarily follow that listening to the voice of the nightingale is forbidden because it is not from the Qur'an. And if listening to a meaningless, heedless sound is permissible, then why should listening to a sound from which wisdom [al-hikmah] and sound meanings are understood not be permissible? And indeed, in some poetry there is wisdom [hikmah]. This is a consideration of the sound from the perspective of it being good and beautiful [tayyib hasan].

a.g: Do you not see that Allah has made subject to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth and amply bestowed upon you His favors, [both] apparent and unapparent? But of the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge or guidance or an enlightening Book [from Him].
And when it is said to them, "Follow what Allah has revealed," they say, "Rather, we will follow that upon which we found our fathers." Even if Satan was inviting them to the punishment of the Blaze?
And whoever submits his face to Allah while he is a doer of good - then he has grasped the most trustworthy handhold. And to Allah will be the outcome of [all] matters.
And whoever has disbelieved - let not his disbelief grieve you. To Us is their return, and We will inform them of what they did. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts.
We grant them enjoyment for a little; then We will force them to a massive punishment.
And if you asked them, "Who created the heavens and earth?" they would surely say, "Allah." Say, "[All] praise is [due] to Allah "; but most of them do not know.

a.g: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. Indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

And if whatever trees upon the earth were pens and the sea [was ink], replenished thereafter by seven [more] seas, the words of Allah would not be exhausted. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.

a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

ğŸ“– Vol 1: Foundations of Belief
Indeed, just as the righteous [al-abrar] find increase in their state [hal] and their knowledge [ma'rifa] through their proximity to those drawn near [al-muqarrabun] and their witnessing of them, so too will be their state in the Hereafter [al-akhirah]: "Your creation and your resurrection are not but as a single soul. As We began the first creation, We will repeat it." And as the Exalted has said: "A reward in accordance" â€” meaning the recompense [jaza'] corresponds to their deeds. So the pure [al-khalis] is met with the purest of drink, and the mixed [al-mashub] is met with the mixed. And every drink is mixed according to the measure of what preceded of mixture in his love [hubb] and his deeds. "So whoever does an atom's weight of good will see it, and whoever does an atom's weight of evil will see it." â€” "And indeed, Allah does not change the condition of a people until they change what is in themselves." â€” "Indeed, Allah does not do injustice, [even] as much as an atom's weight. And if there is a good deed, He multiplies it." â€” "And if it should be the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth. And sufficient are We as accountant." So whoever, in this world [al-dunya], his love [hubb] was his hope for the bliss of Paradise, the maidens with large, [beautiful] eyes, and the palaces, he is granted a place in Paradise to settle therein wherever he wishes, to play with the eternal youths and enjoy the women. There his pleasure [ladhdhah] in the Hereafter [al-akhirah] ends, for indeed, every person is given in love [mahabbah] what his soul [nafs] desires and what delights his eye.

a.g: Do you not see that Allah causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night and has subjected the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term, and that Allah, with whatever you do, is Acquainted?
That is because Allah is the Truth, and that what they call upon other than Him is falsehood, and because Allah is the Most High, the Grand.
Do you not see that ships sail through the sea by the favor of Allah that He may show you of His signs? Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.

And when waves come over them like canopies, they supplicate Allah, sincere to Him in religion. But when He delivers them to the land, there are [some] of them who are moderate [in faith]. And none rejects Our signs except everyone treacherous and ungrateful.

O mankind, fear your Lord and fear a Day when no father will avail his son, nor will a son avail his father at all. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth, so let not the worldly life delude you and be not deceived about Allah by the Deceiver.
